title: Album Page, "Heidelberg Castle from the Bridge over the Necker", September 16,1887
medium: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, below drawing, right of center: Heidelberg Castle from the / Bridge over the Necker / Sept 16th 1887.  At top right corner: (inscribed in circle) 45 / 57.
description: Horizontal sheet tipped vertically into binding.  Depicted is a large castle complex on a hill surrounded by trees.  The central building is multistoried with a steeply pitched roof and turret visible.  Behind this is a lower windowed building that terminates in a larger, octagonal four-story tower.  Lower buildings are joined in front of the central building, with a fortified, semicircular structure overlooking the bluff.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Heidelberg Castle from the Bridge over the Necker", September 16,1887.
September 16,1887. Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-125.
